description: Ms. composite codex. Physical description: Texts 1-2, 21 lines per page; written in casual naskh in brown on glazed, laid European paper; rubrication and catchwords. Text 3, 21 lines per page; written in small naskh in black on glazed, laid European paper; rubrication and catchwords. Text 4, 21 lines per page; written in small, casual naskh in brown (switches to black on leaf 198b) on glazed, laid European paper; rubrication and catchwords. Upper edge damp-stained and moldered. Leaves 1-15, 214 detached. Origin: Text 1, 6 Jumādá II 1088 H [6 August 1677] (leaf 10a). Text 4, 8 Jumādá II 1088 H (8 August 1677), by Saʻd al-Dīn ibn Muḥammad ibn Quṭb al-Dīn ibn Tamām al-Jazāʼirī (leaf 212b). Remaining texts likely completed around the same time.
abstract: Collection of texts on Shiʻite fiqh.
contents: 4. leaves 88a-212b: Sharḥ Alfīyat Shahīd / al-Shahīd al-Thānī.
extent: 214 leaves : paper ; 206 x 154 (120-163 x 77-104) mm bound to 207 x 159 mm
title: Sharḥ Alfīyat Shahīd ... [etc.].
subject: Manuscripts, Arabic—New Jersey—Princeton
binding note: Limp orange-brown leather with blind-stamped fillets and blind-tooled central star.
member of collections: Princeton Digital Library of Islamic Manuscripts
